intro: Eriogonum puberulum, commonly known as the hairy buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Eriogonum puberulum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
